intro: Odostemon wilcoxii, commonly known as the Wilcox's odostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features include finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Odostemon wilcoxii is often found in prairie and woodland habitats, contributing to local biodiversity.
